snippet: The secretary of state said the change, which takes effect immediately, is the result of a review after the Supreme Court’s decision on the Defense of Marriage Act.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, announcing a policy change set in motion in June, says United States will treat visa applications of same-sex married couples in same manner as opposite-sex spouses; change will take effect immediately, and will apply to American citizens as well as foreign same-sex couples, dependent only on the marriage's having taken place in a jurisdiction that recognizes same-sex marriage.

byline.contributor: Marc Santora contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The secretary of state said the change, which takes effect immediately, is the result of a review after the Supreme Court’s decision on the Defense of Marriage Act.

headline.main: New U.S. Policy Gives Equal Treatment to Same-Sex Spouses’ Visa Applications
